original_solution_mapping.L1: There will be $100/$50 = <<100/50=2>>2 pieces of $50 when $100 is changed to $50 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So there will be $50/$10 = <<50/10=5>>5 pieces of $10 when $50 is changed to $10 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L4: The remaining $50 will be changed to $5 bills so there will be $50/$5 = <<50/5=10>>10 pieces of $5 bills.
original_solution_mapping.L5: So in total, Lorie will have 2 $50 bills + 5 $10 bills + 10 $5 bills = <<2+5+10=17>>17 pieces of bills.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3426.
    Returns: the total number of pieces of bills Lorie will have.
    """
    # L1
    bill_value_100 = 100 # $100 bills
    bill_value_50 = 50 # $50 bills
    pieces_of_50_from_first_100 = bill_value_100 / bill_value_50

    # L2
    half_divisor = 2 # Half of the remaining $100 bill
    value_of_half_100_bill = bill_value_100 / half_divisor

    # L3
    bill_value_10 = 10 # $10 bills
    pieces_of_10_from_half_100 = value_of_half_100_bill / bill_value_10

    # L4
    bill_value_5 = 5 # $5 bills
    pieces_of_5_from_other_half_100 = value_of_half_100_bill / bill_value_5

    # L5
    total_pieces_of_bills = pieces_of_50_from_first_100 + pieces_of_10_from_half_100 + pieces_of_5_from_other_half_100

    # FA
    answer = total_pieces_of_bills
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There will be ${bill_value_100}/${bill_value_50} = <<{bill_value_100}/{bill_value_50}={pieces_of_50_from_first_100}>>{pieces_of_50_from_first_100} pieces of $50 when ${bill_value_100} is changed to $50 bills.

So there will be ${value_of_half_100_bill}/${bill_value_10} = <<{value_of_half_100_bill}/{bill_value_10}={pieces_of_10_from_half_100}>>{pieces_of_10_from_half_100} pieces of $10 when ${value_of_half_100_bill} is changed to $10 bills.

The remaining ${value_of_half_100_bill} will be changed to $5 bills so there will be ${value_of_half_100_bill}/${bill_value_5} = <<{value_of_half_100_bill}/{bill_value_5}={pieces_of_5_from_other_half_100}>>{pieces_of_5_from_other_half_100} pieces of $5 bills.

So in total, Lorie will have {pieces_of_50_from_first_100} $50 bills + {pieces_of_10_from_half_100} $10 bills + {pieces_of_5_from_other_half_100} $5 bills = <<{pieces_of_50_from_first_100}+{pieces_of_10_from_half_100}+{pieces_of_5_from_other_half_100}={total_pieces_of_bills}>>{total_pieces_of_bills} pieces of bills.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There will be $100/$50 = <<100/50=2>>2 pieces of $50 when $100 is changed to $50 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So there will be $50/$10 = <<50/10=5>>5 pieces of $10 when $50 is changed to $10 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: The remaining $100 will be changed to $5 bills so there will be $100/$5 = <<100/5=20>>20 pieces of $5 bills.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: So in total, Lorie will have 2 $50 bills + 5 $10 bills + 20 $5 bills = <<2+5+20=27>>27 pieces of bills.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'bill_value_100' (value: 100) was used instead of 'value_of_half_100_bill' (value: 50.0).
